messages.content: I'm writing as one of your neighbours about the elections next week. I don't normally get involved in politics, but I am sure that this year our votes will make a big difference.

I've been in touch with Emily Thornberry – she really listened and helped me out. I am impressed by her positive attitude to improving services for Islington residents, and I know she's stood up for a lot of people around here. I want Emily to be re-elected as our Labour MP, and that's why I'm voting for her and the Labour team on May 6th.
I'm worried that people in our area might rely on other people to vote, or they might waste their vote on one of the smaller parties – we don't want to risk ending up with a Tory Government.

So I wanted to ask you to join me in supporting Emily – please don't waste your chance to vote in this very important election, please go along to the polling station on May 6th and vote for a Labour MP and a Labour council.

mentions.tacticalSituation: I'm worried that people in our area might rely on other people to vote, or they might waste their vote on one of the smaller parties – we don't want to risk ending up with a Tory Government.

leaflet.personalStatement: she really listened and helped me out.

images.caption: A letter from a neighbour endorsing Emily Thornberry for the Islington constituency.

leaflet.additionalNotes: This leaflet appears to be a personal endorsement from a neighbor rather than a direct communication from the candidate or party.
